info.title: Auto-generated OAS of ProShop using OOPS

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Keyword to search/filter products by name

200.description: List of products with pagination info

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: JWT authentication cookie. The server expects a cookie named 'jwt' containing the JWT; this header should include that cookie (e.g. "jwt=<token>"). Required for authenticated admin access.

401.description: Unauthorized - authentication required or invalid token

403.description: Forbidden - authenticated user is not an admin

401.description: Not authorized, token failed or user not admin

404.description: Product not found or invalid ObjectId
Product not found or invalid ObjectId

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: Authentication cookie containing JWT (cookie name: jwt). Required for protected route.

requestBody.description: Review object containing rating and comment

401.description: Not authorized - either not logged in or not an admin

400.description: Bad Request - User already exists or invalid user data

401.description: Not authorized, token failed or no token provided
Not authorized, token failed or no token provided
Not authorized - either no token provided, invalid token, or user is not an admin

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the user to update

requestBody.description: User fields to update. Any of the properties may be provided (partial updates supported).

400.description: Cannot delete admin user or invalid request

401.description: Not authorized, either not logged in or not an admin

requestBody.description: Order payload. orderItems (non-empty array), shippingAddress and paymentMethod are required. Note: server will use product prices from the database and will ignore client-supplied prices.

500.description: Server error - could be payment not verified, transaction already used, or incorrect amount paid

200.description: Order successfully updated to delivered status

401.description: Not authorized - user not authenticated or not an admin

stack.example: Error stack trace in development mode

isAdmin.description: Whether the user is an admin

user.description: User id who created the product

_id.description: Product ID (used by server to look up canonical product and price)

name.description: Product name (optional on client; server will use DB values as authoritative)

price.description: Client-supplied price (ignored by server; server uses DB price)
